cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast, skirting the North Carolina coast tonight then accelerating offshore toward the Mid-Atlantic and Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear / southern Outer Banks, NC (brush or very near-coast passage)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for this stretch of coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC northward to the NC/VA border, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast and central North Carolina coast, including Cape Fear, Wilmington, and Outer Banks
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts and sustained tropical-storm to hurricane winds (50–100 mph) likely as eye grazes Cape Fear area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening inundation of 4–7 ft possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with locally up to 15 inches possible, producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Embedded tornadoes in rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents; power outages and debris.
